title: Royal mummy
data:
***Version [0.31](/0.31 "0.31")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

*For a list of all mummies, see [list of mummies](/List_of_mummies "List of mummies").*

| royal mummy M [![Royal mummy.png](/images/6/6e/Royal_mummy.png)](/File:Royal_mummy.png) |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |

| [Vulnerabilities](/Vulnerability "Vulnerability")                                       | [Holy](/Holy "Holy")                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| [Habitat](/Habitat "Habitat")                                                           | Land                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |

| [Uses](/Item_usage "Item usage")                                                        | [Weapons & armour](/Category:Weapons_armour "Category:Weapons armour") [Starting equipment](/Item_usage "Item usage") [Open doors](/Category:Open_doors "Category:Open doors")                                                  |
| [Holiness](/Holiness "Holiness")                                                        | [Undead](/Category:Undead_holiness "Category:Undead holiness")                                                                                                                                                                  |

|   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| - | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
|   | An ancient pharaoh, embalmed and cursed to undeath, now capable of great and terrifying feats of magic.***“I see Egypt and the Egyptians — I see the pyramids and obelisks; I look on chisel’d histories, songs, philosophies, cut in slabs of sand-stone, or on granite-blocks; I see at Memphis mummy-pits, containing mummies, embalm’d, swathed in linen cloth, lying there many centuries; I look on the fall’n Theban, the large-ball’d eyes, the side-drooping neck, the hands folded across the breast.” -Walt Whitman, “Salut au Monde” |

## Contents

- [1 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
- [2 Spells](#Spells)
- [3 Tips & Tricks](#Tips_.26_Tricks)
- [4 History](#History)

## Useful Info

**Royal mummies** are the most powerful and durable mummies, the bane of unprepared adventurers. They can [torment](/Torment "Torment") you, have great HP, and cause the most powerful [death curses](/Death_curse "Death curse"). They can be found in [the Tomb](/The_Tomb "The Tomb"), on Tomb-themed [Ziggurat](/Ziggurat "Ziggurat") floors, and in the company of [Khufu](/Khufu "Khufu").

## Spells

| Spell set I |                                                                                  |                                                     |
| :---------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------- |
| Slot1       | [Smiting](/Smiting "Smiting") (7-17)                                             | [Wizard flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |
| Slot2       | [Symbol of Torment](/Symbol_of_Torment "Symbol of Torment")                      | [Wizard flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |
| Slot3       | [Summon Emperor Scorpions](/Summon_Emperor_Scorpions "Summon Emperor Scorpions") | [Wizard flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |
| Slot4       | [Summon Scarabs](/Summon_Scarabs "Summon Scarabs")                               | [Wizard flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |

## Tips & Tricks

- Royal mummies are extremely dangerous: they can [torment](/Torment "Torment") and smite from a safe distance, summon [slowing](/Slow "Slow") death scarabs, and have *amazing* durability. They'll often survive multiple casts of mid-power [Fire Storm](/Fire_Storm "Fire Storm"), [Ignition](/Ignition "Ignition"), [Shatter](/Shatter "Shatter"), [Dispel Undead](/Dispel_Undead "Dispel Undead"), etc., so it's tough to take them down quickly.
- Catching them with [Silence](/Silence "Silence") will shut down all of their spells, making them much more manageable.
- Being [undead](/Undead "Undead") (through [Death Form](/Death_Form "Death Form") or species) will take much of the sting out of their death curse.
- For such a strong monster, they have decidedly a lackluster [HD](/HD "HD") of 15. Unfortunately, their high [willpower](/Willpower "Willpower") and undead resistances make this mostly irrelevant, but it does make them vulnerable to [Zin](/Zin "Zin")'s Recite.

## History

- Prior to [0.27](/0.27 "0.27"), royal mummies could have one of four possible spell sets:

  - [Smiting](/Smiting "Smiting") (7-17), [Symbol of Torment](/Symbol_of_Torment "Symbol of Torment"), [Summon Demon](/Summon_Demon "Summon Demon"), and [Summon Emperor Scorpions](/Summon_Emperor_Scorpions "Summon Emperor Scorpions")
  - [Smiting](/Smiting "Smiting") (7-17), [Symbol of Torment](/Symbol_of_Torment "Symbol of Torment"), [Summon Demon](/Summon_Demon "Summon Demon"), and [Summon Undead](/Summon_Undead "Summon Undead")
  - [Smiting](/Smiting "Smiting") (7-17), [Symbol of Torment](/Symbol_of_Torment "Symbol of Torment"), [Summon Emperor Scorpions](/Summon_Emperor_Scorpions "Summon Emperor Scorpions"), and [Summon Scarabs](/Summon_Scarabs "Summon Scarabs")
  - [Smiting](/Smiting "Smiting") (7-17), [Symbol of Torment](/Symbol_of_Torment "Symbol of Torment"), [Summon Mana Viper](/Summon_Mana_Viper "Summon Mana Viper"), and [Summon Undead](/Summon_Undead "Summon Undead")

- Prior to [0.26](/0.26 "0.26"), royal mummies were known as **greater mummies**.
html:
Royal mummy

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.31: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.

For a list of all mummies, see list of mummies.

royal mummy M 
HP 128-260
HD 15
XP 6226
Speed 10
AC 10
EV 6
Will 160
Attack1 35 (hit: plain)


Resistances rC+
rElec
rPois+++
rDrown
rMiasma
rN+++
rTorm
Vulnerabilities Holy
Habitat Land
Intelligence Human
Uses Weapons & armour
Starting equipment
Open doors
Holiness Undead
Size Medium
Type mummy, mummy
Flags Evil
See invisible
Unbreathing
Speaks
An ancient pharaoh, embalmed and cursed to undeath, now capable of great and terrifying feats of magic.

“I see Egypt and the Egyptians — I see the pyramids and obelisks;
I look on chisel’d histories, songs, philosophies, cut in slabs
of sand-stone, or on granite-blocks;
I see at Memphis mummy-pits, containing mummies, embalm’d, swathed
in linen cloth, lying there many centuries;
I look on the fall’n Theban, the large-ball’d eyes, the side-drooping
neck, the hands folded across the breast.”
-Walt Whitman, “Salut au Monde”

Contents

  • 1 Useful Info
  • 2 Spells
  • 3 Tips & Tricks
  • 4 History

Useful Info

Royal mummies are the most powerful and durable mummies, the bane of unprepared adventurers. They can torment you, have great HP, and cause the most powerful death curses. They can be found in the Tomb, on Tomb-themed Ziggurat floors, and in the company of Khufu.

Spells

Spell set I
Slot1 Smiting (7-17) Wizard flag
Slot2 Symbol of Torment Wizard flag
Slot3 Summon Emperor Scorpions Wizard flag
Slot4 Summon Scarabs Wizard flag

Tips & Tricks

  • Royal mummies are extremely dangerous: they can torment and smite from a safe distance, summon slowing death scarabs, and have amazing durability. They'll often survive multiple casts of mid-power Fire Storm, Ignition, Shatter, Dispel Undead, etc., so it's tough to take them down quickly.
  • Catching them with Silence will shut down all of their spells, making them much more manageable.
  • Being undead (through Death Form or species) will take much of the sting out of their death curse.
  • For such a strong monster, they have decidedly a lackluster HD of 15. Unfortunately, their high willpower and undead resistances make this mostly irrelevant, but it does make them vulnerable to Zin's Recite.

History

  • Prior to 0.27, royal mummies could have one of four possible spell sets:
    • Smiting (7-17), Symbol of Torment, Summon Demon, and Summon Emperor Scorpions
    • Smiting (7-17), Symbol of Torment, Summon Demon, and Summon Undead
    • Smiting (7-17), Symbol of Torment, Summon Emperor Scorpions, and Summon Scarabs
    • Smiting (7-17), Symbol of Torment, Summon Mana Viper, and Summon Undead
  • Prior to 0.26, royal mummies were known as greater mummies.

{{version031}}
{{list of|mummies}}
{{monster info}}

==Useful Info==
'''Royal mummies''' are the most powerful and durable mummies, the bane of unprepared adventurers. They can [[torment]] you, have great HP, and cause the most powerful [[death curse]]s. They can be found in [[the Tomb]], on Tomb-themed [[Ziggurat]] floors, and in the company of [[Khufu]].

{{monster spells}}

==Tips & Tricks==
*Royal mummies are extremely dangerous: they can [[torment]] and smite from a safe distance, summon [[slow]]ing death scarabs, and have ''amazing'' durability. They'll often survive multiple casts of mid-power [[Fire Storm]], [[Ignition]], [[Shatter]], [[Dispel Undead]], etc., so it's tough to take them down quickly.
*Catching them with [[Silence]] will shut down all of their spells, making them much more manageable.
*Being [[undead]] (through [[Death Form]] or species) will take much of the sting out of their death curse.
*For such a strong monster, they have decidedly a lackluster [[HD]] of 15. Unfortunately, their high [[willpower]] and undead resistances make this mostly irrelevant, but it does make them vulnerable to [[Zin]]'s Recite.

==History==
*Prior to [[0.27]], royal mummies could have one of four possible spell sets:
**[[Smiting]] (7-17), [[Symbol of Torment]], [[Summon Demon]], and [[Summon Emperor Scorpions]]
**[[Smiting]] (7-17), [[Symbol of Torment]], [[Summon Demon]], and [[Summon Undead]]
**[[Smiting]] (7-17), [[Symbol of Torment]], [[Summon Emperor Scorpions]], and [[Summon Scarabs]]
**[[Smiting]] (7-17), [[Symbol of Torment]], [[Summon Mana Viper]], and [[Summon Undead]]
*Prior to [[0.26]], royal mummies were known as '''greater mummies'''.

[[Category:Mummy]]
